definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: These bars buds themselves also produce auxin .
sentences.chinese: 而这些叶芽本身也可以生成生长素。

sentences.english: Endogenous auxin, or indole-3-acetic acid (IAA), plays a central role during root induction in woody plants.
sentences.chinese: 生长素类物质在木本植物生根过程中发挥重要作用。

sentences.english: It is antagonistic to abscisic acid in abscission.
sentences.chinese: 在脱落过程中生长素与脱落酸有拮抗作用。

sentences.english: Hormones, especially auxins, are involved in the promotion of elongation.
sentences.chinese: 激素尤其是植物生长素可以促进细胞壁的延伸。

sentences.english: Ghrelin is produced mostly by cells in the stomach lining.
sentences.chinese: 胃促生长素主要由胃保护层的细胞产生。

sentences.english: Many plants may thrive in extra light but light also destroys auxin.
sentences.chinese: 许多植物可以茁壮成长，但额外光灯也摧毁了生长素。

sentences.english: You must be auxin, cause you are causing me to have rapid stem elongation.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是生长素，因为你让我的茎迅速的延长。

sentences.english: Cytokinin is known to have negative effects on denovo auxin-induced root formation.
sentences.chinese: 细胞分裂素对生长素诱导的根的形成具有负向作用。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effect of Chinese traditional medicine pilose antler growth factor on cell proliferation.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究鹿茸生长素对关节软骨细胞增殖的影响。

sentences.english: The buds release this hormone down the plant stem.
sentences.chinese: 顶芽将生长素释放至植株茎部。

definition: coleoptile, protective sheath covering an emerging shoot (botany)
anabolism (biology)/constructive metabolism (using energy to make proteins etc)/assimilation
terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)
testosterone/also written 睾甾酮[gao1 zai1 tong2]
